His passion for genetics, bioinformatics, and entomology helps to support the cutting-edge innovation being done within the agency. title: F-Gas Inspections | Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Ireland
description:
Last week the EPA undertook inspections of various Authorised Treatment Facilities with Inspectors from Cork City Council, Limerick City and County Council and the Waste Enforcement Regional Lead Authority (WERLA). End of Life Vehicles are taken apart and depolluted at these facilities

The purpose of these inspections was to determine whether air conditioning gases are being correctly removed from vehicles and to raise awareness on recent national and EU regulatory changes. Air conditioning gases typically contain hazardous fluorinated greenhouse gases (F-Gases), the most potent greenhouse gases. Their use is restricted and they are due to be phased out by 2050.

The inspection campaign highlighted the need for improvements in F-gas recovery practices and hazardous waste reporting. EPA Guidance is available at: https://lnkd.in/d69KBqNg

description: OAKLAND – California Attorney General Rob Bonta, together with local, state, and federal law enforcement partners, today announced the eradication of 728,458 illegally cultivated cannabis plants and 204 arrests in 34 different counties across California in 2025 as part of the Eradication and Prevention of Illicit Cannabis (EPIC) program. EPIC is an interagency task force focused on combating the illegal cannabis market, cannabis enforcement work, and investigating and prosecuting civil and criminal cases with a focus on environmental, economic, and labor impacts from illegal cultivation.

name: Opposition & Allies
title: Coolfmlive - BREAKING NEWS...Message Release from the Arizona Department of Environmental Quality.  "We are reaching out with an update on the status of the proposed air quality permit (No. 106233) for Aluminum Dynamics, Inc. (ADI). After thoroughly reviewing and considering all comments submitted during the public comment period, the Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has made the determination to issue the proposed final air quality permit to ADI on Dec. 17, 2025.   What this means:  ADI is now authorized to begin construction of its facility in Benson, Arizona.   ADI is not authorized to begin operations at the facility.   ADEQ values the input you provided during the formal public comment period, and made changes to the proposed final air quality permit based on some of the feedback we received. ADEQ’s changes to the proposed final air quality permit are highlighted in the public comment Responsiveness Summary.    As required, ADEQ is sending the proposed final air quality permit and supporting documents to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) for its 45-day review:    If EPA approves the proposed final air quality permit, ADEQ will make a final decision on the air quality permit.   If EPA objects to the proposed final air quality permit, ADEQ must address and resolve EPA’s objections within 90 days before it can either issue the final air quality permit or deny the permit.  #News #Bensonaz | Facebook
